zone.line: Out of their rest, & gathered in the streets 370
Looking in wonder up to Heaven, while yet
The music pealed along; I hid myself
Within a fountain in the public square
Where I lay like the reflex of the moon
Seen in a wave under the green leaves—& soon
Those ugly human shapes & visages
Of which I spoke as having wrought me pain
Past floating thro' the air, & fading still
Into the winds that scatter them, & those
From whom they passed seemed mild & lovely 380
forms
After some foul disguise had fallen — & all
Were somewhat changed — and after brief surprise
And greetings of delighted wonder, all
Went to their sleep again — and when the dawn
Came — wouldst thou think that toads & snakes
& efts
Could e'er be beautiful ?— yet so they were
And that with little change of shape or hue
All things had put their evil nature off
I cannot tell my joy, when oer a lake,
